Sensory & Consumer Science Manager - Southbank

Company Name Carlton & United Breweries Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About CUB

Carlton & United Breweries (CUB) is one of Australia’s most iconic companies. We locally brew some of Australia's most famous beers including Victoria Bitter, Carlton Draught, Pure Blonde, Great Northern, Matilda Bay and ciders including Strongbow, Mercury and Bulmers, as well as distribute some of the world’s leading international brands including Corona, Stella Artois and Budweiser.

Joining CUB, you are opening up a world of career possibilities. We are a part of AB InBev, the largest and only truly global brewer selling over 400 brands across 100 markets and employing 200,000 people. Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. We are committed to driving growth that leads to better living for more people in more places and focused on bringing people and cultures together through our brands and experiences.

The Role

This role is responsible for leading the strategic thinking in Sensory & Consumer Science, take charge of Strategic Product Monitoring (SPM) and Competitiveness Product Testing (CPT) while managing zone Operational responsibilities in the Sensory & Consumer Science field.

Responsibilities will be (but not limited to)
  • Provide sensory insights into the APAC South product portfolio – using tools such as Product Landscape, taste profiles, analytical results and competitor information to guide product development
  • Lead the sensory strategy for APAC South, overseeing the Technical Development Taste function
  • Conduct internal tasting with the Zone Innovation & Technology (ZITEC), Insights & Innovation teams
  • Conduct quantitative testing with consumers and lead decisions relating to product performance
  • New Product Development (NPD) – collaborate with Global and other Zones to source information


Who You Are

You are someone who has an innovative and strategic mindset. You are a leader who excels working with ambiguity in a fast paced environment.
  • Tertiary qualified in Food Science & Technology is preferred, experienced in applied statistical methods is advantageous
  • At least 4+ years’ relevant experience within the alcoholic beverage and/or food industries
  • Experience and knowledge of Sensory and Consumer research methodologies
  • Exposure and thorough understanding of the NPD process
  • Innovation and problem solving skills – applying new solutions to old problems
  • Use leadership experience to influence and challenge current processes
  • Ability to prioritise and manage time effectively with multiple projects
  • A passion for beer is beneficial


What We Offer

Learn on the job. Jump in at the deep-end. Dream big!

At CUB, our greatest strength is our people. We recruit people who can be better than ourselves and retain people by allowing them to grow at their own pace, providing training opportunities and offering a safe environment where they will be rewarded for their contributions. To learn more, visit CUB - Our 10 principles.

Join one of the world’s largest consumer packaged goods companies where opportunity awaits. Apply now!

Associate

Business Continuity Leader - Quality, Audit and Risk

Company Name Chisholm Institute Company Location Dandenong, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 29 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full time, ongoing
  • Salary Range: $89,356 to $97,339 p.a plus Superannuation
  • Location: Dandenong


About Us

Chisholm is Victoria’s premier public vocational education and training provider, with campuses located across Melbourne and the south east.

Each year, we welcome some 30,000 students from over 43 culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. More than 1,200 passionate and dedicated Chisholm employees work together to deliver quality training and education in Melbourne’s south east manufacturing heartland and key residential growth corridor.

A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.

Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be respected and valued for enhancing the social and economic futures of individuals, industry and communities.

Our drive for commercial success is underpinned by our core values of Opportunity, Integrity, Collaboration, and Achievement.

In the past 20 years, we have grown significantly to become a multi-sector institute, delivering a broad range of education and training programs and services in higher education, vocational education and training (VET) and school sectors across ten campuses in Victoria, online, in the workplace and overseas with partner educational and government organisations.

We offer more than 400 courses, from VCE/VCAL/VETiS, through to nationally accredited qualifications such as certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, graduate diplomas and short courses.

About The Role

The Business Continuity Leader is accountable to provide end-to-end responsibility for the development and implementation of the Institute’s Business Continuity strategy and will report into the Risk Manager.

Your Key Accountabilities Will Be To
  • Develop, implement, manage and evaluate Business Continuity policies, plans, procedures, reporting and activities that support the achievement of Chisholm’s goals.
  • Develop internal policies and procedures and manage the audit process with internal and external auditors, providing support and contributing to the annual Board internal audit plan.
  • Manage and perform control assessments of Business Continuity plans to confirm that opportunities for improvements have been implemented.
  • Develop and maintain excellent working relationships with the Board, ARMC, EDG, CLG, to facilitate outcomes aligned to the Institute’s goals.
  • Engage staff through a range of strategies to ensure capability and understanding of business continuity policies and procedures.


About You

You will have relevant tertiary qualification in adult education, business, project management or business continuity related disciplines.

Crucial to your success will be significant and diverse proven experience in business continuity practices and techniques and the coordination of business continuity processes to strict set deadlines. With an ability to communicate with various stakeholders and influence change, you will be a key member of the Quality Audit & Risk Team in achieving Chisholm’s 2020 Vision commitment.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

At Chisholm, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to attract, recruit, engage and retain a team of talented people. If you require specific support to apply for this position, please advise the recruiting manager whose contact details are listed in the advertisement. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you.

How To Apply

Applications for this position close 5pm Monday 10th September 2018

Applications Should Include
  • a covering letter
  • curriculum vitae
  • contact details of three (3) referees

Appointment to this position is subject to satisfactory completion of Safety Screening requirements including but not limited to:
  • valid Employee Working With Children Check
  • National Police Check
  • International Police Check (if applicable)
  • verification of unrestricted work rights in Australia, eg citizenship, passport or birth certificate
  • certified copies of qualifications

If you have any questions regarding the position or require further information please contact Geoffrey Hardwicke, Manager – Quality, Audit and Risk on +61 3 9212 5151.

Chisholm Institute reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Higher Education
  • Education Management

RCR Tomlinson is at the forefront of Melbourne's developing Rail Network delivering market-leading engineering, design, installation and maintenance services to the Rail and Transport sectors.

837775253:
[

Senior Dev Ops Engineer

Company Name Verrency Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Verrency is a two year old Melbourne based Start-Up which provides software to banks globally, allowing them to add new features to their Debit and Credit Cards, without the need to make internal IT systems changes.

With the recent signing of our first customers we are looking to expand our team, and so are recruiting for a number of people to join our Melbourne based development team.

\xa0

The Role

We are looking for a Senior Dev Ops Engineer to help continue our focus on 100% CI/CD/CT, and automated production monitoring and response, and bring new capabilities to the team as we expand into areas such as Kubernetes.


We have a design strategy of “No human hands after code-commit” – making our Dev Ops team one of the most important parts of our technical capability, and something we factor into every aspect of our platform design.

\xa0

The Perfect Person

You will want to work in an environment of really technically excellent peers, with a focus on doing an awesome job, using modern technology, and without a corporate bureaucracy slowing down decision making, in a pleasant, fun and focused work environment. \xa0Like almost all technology roles at Verrency, this is a completely hands-on role.


\xa0You’re the sort of person that is aware of new trends and tools in the development landscape, and want to always be improving how we operate.


Verrency is an AWS shop, so you will have experience in the environment. But as there is always two ways to solve every problem in AWS, we’re not looking for a 100% fit to our tool set – we’re looking for technical skills in the discipline, and the ability to learn new tooling quickly as needed.


What is important is to have detailed experience in CI/CD within AWS with strong experience in CI tools like Circle CI, monitoring tools such as Graphite/Grafana and experience in containerisation, where we currently use Docker heavily. We are looking to take on Kubernetes, so experience there is an advantage.


The Team\xa0

You will be joining a small technology team here in Melbourne (14 people at the end of this round of recruitment), made up some really exceptionally talented engineers who love what they do, and have built out an amazing platform. Quite a few of the team are former team-leads or managers who’ve decided they would rather stay on the tools, and this means the experience level is a little different to your average start up.


We believe strongly in personal accountability, and freedom to take the time to solve problems the right way. The team has a strong focus on taking personal ownership of a specific problem, and then working to support each other to ensure the solution is the best possible approach. Pair-programming and regular design and code review are a core part of what we do, and we expect everyone to be open to take on feedback and respond accordingly. We also know that no one succeeds alone, and when there are challenging problems, or hard to identify bugs, everyone comes together to help everyone move forward.


We actively support staff wanting to be active in the local tech community with meetups and speaking opportunities, as well as assisting with conference presentations (domestic and international).


There are no sacred cows in the team – just a focus on solving some pretty complex problems quickly, effectively, and with an appropriate attention to detail.

\xa0

Applying:

If you think you we are the perfect company for you, and you are the perfect person for us, then please apply to the role..


As a start-up we’re always open to discuss flexible working arrangements with amazing people, however this is a Melbourne based role and we are not considering permanent remote working at this time.


Note : You MUST have the right to work in Australia. If you are an international applicant wanting to relocate to (or back to) Melbourne, please provide confirmation of right-to work in the application.

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 302 views

Job description


As we continue to grow, our organisation is increasingly becoming complex and with increased complexity comes the necessity to build out our capability in all legal matters affecting Aesop. We plan to do this by adding expertise in core areas and adding talent in regional locations, with the long-term plan to reduce the reliance on outside counsel.

The newly created role as Director of Legal will represent Aesop within the Corporate Group on legal matters as the key partner for centralised initiatives, strategy and opportunities. You will continually be identifying and refresh the company's legal needs and strategy, ensuring legal exposure is both minimised and consistent across all regions. Crucial to the success of this role will be building a capable Legal and Risk/Compliance team both centrally and in region. You will also be accountable for corporate governance, company secretarial responsibilities, at the same time lead a strong Risk function which identifies and mitigates risks through collaboration with functional and regional heads.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Design and lead the company's Legal & Risk strategy to ensure alignment with both the Aesop executive committee and the Corporate Group requirements
  • Lead and develop a commercial legal team to partner closely with business functions and regions to provide prompt and practical commercial and legal advice on the Group's business activities. This will include development of robust policy framework for Group compliance activities such Privacy, Personnel Compliance (Ethics, Whistle-blower channel), PCI DSS, Workplace Health and Safety and Competition/Anti-trust.
  • Facilitate and strengthen operational decision-making through integration of legal analysis as part of overall business development process.
  • Develop proactive strategy which assesses and protects the company's intellectual property across existing and prospective markets
  • Ensure the company not only conducts itself ethically but upholds operational and employee behaviour that comply with legal and regulatory frameworks


You are a commercially savvy professional with broad business acumen, adept at building teams and with the ability to influence and advise key stake holders within the organisation.

You have a relevant degree with at least 5 years' experience in a commercial environment and hold up to date Australian legal qualifications. You have highly developed networking skills, experience leading and building diverse legal teams and advanced negotiation skills. You have spent significant time in practise supporting a diverse and complex business, with a great track record in corporate governance. Further, you have international operational experience, strong ethics and cultural awareness. Lastly, you have experience counselling global organisations and senior level management on a wide range of legal issues.

Job description

Job Description

Mechanical Fitter/Technician

We are currently recruiting a skilled and experienced Mechanical Fitter/Technician to work with a great Team in our busy Pharmaceutical Manufacturing facility in Braeside.

This position requires sound mechanical, problem solving and logical reasoning aptitude, responsible for:
  • Analysing and identifying issues with equipment, machinery and facilities and efficiently restoring them to good working order in a timely manner
  • Following processes and procedures in our Pharmaceutical Production facility requiring compliance with set standards of Safety, Quality and Productivity, and
  • Participating in continuous improvement and efficiency initiatives.

This Role Involves

GMP and Environmental Health & Safety:
  • Conduct all activities with due consideration for GMP and the safety of patients, employees, casuals, contractors and visitors on site
  • Adhere to all Company Quality and EHS policies and procedures to ensure safety of all people and products to minimise incidents and/or events
  • Ensure implementation of GMP and safety improvements in direct area of responsibility
  • Ensure all GMP and safety programs are adhered to and improvements are implemented on an ongoing basis
  • Ensure that appropriate PPE is used, replaced/serviced as/when required

Specific Requirements
  • Provide mechanical support to manufacturing operations to address current challenges and make sustainable improvements for greater efficiencies
  • Provide high level mechanical diagnostic fault finding expertise
  • Diagnose causes of, and repair equipment breakdowns, focusing on a “First Time Fix” methodology
  • Working knowledge of PLC to provide appropriate support to manufacturing operations
  • Deliver greater plant reliability through effective mechanical and engineering practices and solutions aimed at sustainable uptime and reliability
  • Work closely with a range of stakeholders/internal customers to support Operational Excellence initiatives and productive outcomes
  • Respond to stakeholders/internal customers’ needs and requirements in a timely and responsive manner
  • Work within a high level GMP, Quality and Safety Management Systems environment
  • Address and manage maintenance problems and improvements to maintain a smooth operation and improve efficiencies
  • Communicate and liaise with all other shifts and Departments to maintain a smooth operation and continuity of the machinery and facilities
  • Comply with all local and corporate processes, policies, procedures and regulations ensuring that all GMP, PIC/s and EHS processes are met to ensure highest quality standards are maintained to protect people and product
  • Be able to legally work in Australia on an ongoing, permanent basis as this is a permanent position

Education/Knowledge/Experience
  • Qualified Mechanical Trade Certificate (or equivalent)
  • Significant experience in GMP, Quality Management and EHS Systems in a manufacturing environment such as; Pharmaceutical or Dairy or Food
  • Good fabrication machining skills to manufacture components required to keep production running
  • Restricted Electrical workers (‘D’ / Motor-Class 2) licence will be highly regarded
  • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a diverse Team
  • Good verbal and comprehensive understanding of written (documentation & instructions) communication and interpersonal skills
  • Self motivated with a strong work ethic and enthusiasm for improving processes, procedures and systems
  • Strong working knowledge of and respect for EHS on-the-job requirements
  • Exposure to Lean and Six Sigma work practices will be highly regarded
  • Sound Mathematical and computer skills - spreadsheets (Microsoft Excel), word processing (Word) and graphics (PowerPoint)
  • Sound understanding of manufacturing principles in a GMP environment
  • Strong understanding of and adherence to Safety and Quality compliance requirements
  • Ability to organize, plan, and execute multiple priorities effectively
This is a great opportunity for a resourceful and innovative person to join a global pharmaceutical service company with a passion for best practice, continuous improvement and excellence who always strives to be the best in the market.

Please apply through Catalent Careers www.catalent.com/careers or Workday Recruiting.

About Catalent

Catalyst + Talent. Our name combines these ideas. From drug and biologic development services, to delivery technologies to supply solutions, our highly skilled and dedicated global team of over 9,500 is passionate about improving health and wellness by combining their personal expertise and advanced technologies to advance science and supply products of the highest quality to customers and patients around the world.

Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career! Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help develop some of the nearly 200 products we launch each year or help supply over 7,000 products for patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where our professionals work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market, for the benefit of patients globally.

Our MISSION is to develop, manufacture and supply products that help people live better, healthier lives.

OUR VALUES are at the foundation of everything we do:
  • Patient First: We put patients at the centre of our work to ensure the safety, reliable supply and optimal performance of our products.
  • Customer Dedication: We strive to exceed our customers’ expectations every day.
  • People: We are committed to the growth, development and engagement of our people.
  • Innovation: We develop and apply innovative solutions, superior technologies and continuously improved processes.
  • Integrity: We demonstrate respect, accountability and honesty in every interaction.
  • Excellence: We have a passion for excellence in everything we do.
Catalent. More products. Better treatments. Reliably supplied.™ Visit www.catalent.com/careers to explore career opportunities.

Job description

Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sydney NSW 2000, Australia; Melbourne VIC 3004, Australia

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Google Cloud Consultant, you will work directly with Google’s most strategic customers on critical projects to help them transform their businesses. Through your consulting and technical capability, you will be providing technical guidance and best practice expertise while working with client executives and technical leaders to deploy solutions via Google’s Cloud Platform.

You possess a diverse background with cloud solutions in areas such as IaaS, Developer Operations, Microservices, Containerisation, Storage, Networking, Security and OSS technology.

As a Cloud Consultant you will architect and design systems, build out proof of concepts, and compare and contrast technology alternatives to deliver technical solutions and lead flawless implementations. Often you will need to stretch products to their limit to find their breaking points.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.

Responsibilities
  • Interact with sales/partner leads and technical stakeholders to translate complex customer requirements into recommendations for appropriate solution architectures.

  • BS degree in a technical or engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant work experience and 3 years of experience building cloud solutions in designing or developing with cloud solutions across data and infrastructure services.

  • Ability to travel (domestic and international) 25% of the time as required.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with deployment and orchestration technologies (such as Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, OpenStack, Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible, Jenkins) along with system administration tasks in Linux, Unix, and Windows.
  • Hands on experience supporting transactional database systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra.
  • Experience in writing scripts in one or more languages such as Python, Go, or similar.
  • Working knowledge of cloud computing including virtualization, hosted services, multi-tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks.
  • Understanding of open source server software (such as NGINX, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch).
  • Strong customer-facing communication and careful listening skills. Proven success in and genuine enthusiasm for working directly with customer technical teams.

\xa0

The perfect first manager role for a senior compliance officer who is wanting to take the next step in their career.

Working at Pitcher Partners gives you greater control of your career.

Our mission is to be the middle market’s preeminent accounting and advisory firm – building strong long-term relationships with our people and clients to nurture and support their needs and development.

We understand that people underpin our success – that’s why we provide a flexible and supportive environment enabling our teams to excel. We’ll encourage you to forge a career path that prepares you for today while positioning you for the future.

\xa0

Your new role

Pitcher Partners Investment Services provides personalised investment advisory, financial planning, investment management and administration services to private clients, family groups, corporate and personal superannuation funds and not-for-profit organisations. Pitcher Partners Investment Services currently serves over 500 clients with funds under management of more than $3 billion.

Working closely with the Director of Risk and Compliance, the Risk and Compliance Team and the Investment Advisory Team, you will manage the day-to-day compliance, risk and quality functions within the Investment Services division of Pitcher Partners Melbourne.\xa0

The role will have primary responsibility for all compliance aspects of the Investment Services division including identifying, implementing and managing legislative and accounting standard changes, licensing, regulatory reporting, the development, implementation and monitoring of controls within a custodian environment, and influencing the quality control and procedural compliance within the division.\xa0

The role will also assist in the development of controls and liaising with external auditors, the\xa0coordination of file reviews, the preparation of Investment Committee and Board papers, attendance at management meetings and the development and assessment of compliance training across the division.\xa0 The role will also play an integral role in the development and maintenance of the division’s strategic risk register and testing of controls, procedures and policies designed to manage any identified risks.

What we bring

Our environment offers flexibility to suit your individual needs and we encourage you to develop and maintain a balanced lifestyle as we recognise that healthy, happy and engaged staff work better and smarter.\xa0

Our firm is the kind of place where you make lifelong friendships and this sense of belonging resonates throughout our firm and provides a strong point of difference from our many competitors.

VIC Sales Manager

Company Name VICE Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 244 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

VICE is for an ambitious, smart generation whose interests cover culture, entertainment, and news, and veer from the profound to the obscure, from the local to the global. Renowned for its original video and innovative brand partnerships, VICE is the market leader in native and branded content, working across all categories including finance, travel, tech, FMCG, auto, fashion, alcohol and entertainment.


VICE is currently looking for an ambitious VIC Sales Manager to join the Melbourne based digital sales team at VICE HQ in Collingwood. Reporting to the Head of Sales, this role requires a minimum of 2 years sales management experience at a digital publisher, or someone with 3-4 years experience at a media agency who wants to cross into a publisher side sales management role.

\xa0

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead partner content, native and digital media sales for VIC
  • Manage internal pipeline, forecasting and revenue reporting for the VIC sales team
  • Working with the VIC sales team to achieve their set sales targets and KPI's
  • Lead media agency and client relationships for the Melbourne market
  • Generate RFP's and new business opportunities
  • Develop strategic approach and proposals for pitches
  • Work with the ad operations and project management teams to ensure successful implementation of campaigns


SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

  • 2+ years sales management experience at a digital publisher, or 3-4 years experience at a media agency
  • Knowledgeable and passionate about youth culture, digital media and branded content / partnerships
  • Proven track record of successfully leading, managing and developing a team
  • Experience in goal setting, forecasting and revenue reporting
  • Team player, high attention to detail, and experience working with multiple stakeholders in a high pressure environment
  • Existing senior media agency relationships in the Melbourne market

\xa0

REMUNERATION


VICE offers a comprehensive base + commissions package, commensurate with experience and abilities.


HOW TO APPLY

Email aucareers@vice.com with "VIC Sales Manager" in the subject field. Include your CV and a short response to the following questions:


  1. Tell us what you can bring to VICE that no one else can?
  2. What is your favourite piece of branded content that you've seen recently and why?
  3. What do you consider the biggest challenge facing the media industry in 2018?


If you do not hear back from us within one month of applying, unfortunately your application has been unsuccessful. Thank you once again for applying and we wish you success in your future career.

Business Development & Marketing Manager - National Markets

Company Name MinterEllison Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 94 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At MinterEllison we take pride in being our clients' best partner, and enjoy working within teams of professionals who share their knowledge, respect our values and support each other to achieve our collective goals. We welcome people who want exciting careers in high performing teams.

Purpose of the role

Our national Client & Market Growth (CMG) team at MinterEllison is a high performing and critical component of the firm and essential to the firm's success. The team supports the partnership by providing the full spectrum of business development and marketing services to ensure the firm develops and maintains strong relationships with new and existing clients.

The Role

You will consult and work closely with key stakeholders and the national Client & Market Growth team to deliver client growth within our middle markets client segment. Key elements of your role will include
  • Managing key client accounts within our 'middle markets' client segments
  • Supporting Partners in assessing sales opportunities and formulating responses to clients, including leveraging support from our Major Pursuits and Tenders team as appropriate
  • Supporting the growth of business development skills across legal practitioners in the business unit through formal and informal coaching and guiding of interactions with clients and networks
  • Designing and executing campaigns to further develop MinterEllison's market positioning
  • Measuring, reporting and assessing the effectiveness of marketing and sales initiatives including identifying and incorporating continuous improvement into future activities
  • Assisting with qualifying opportunities and having a good overview of the sales pipeline in our 'middle markets' segment
  • Working with the Market Lead, National Markets to implement the firmwide strategy to support growth within our 'middle markets' client segment
  • Fostering relationships both with key internal and external clients and the broader CMG group that are collaborative, innovative and value adding.

Our ideal candidate will have the following attributes
  • Broad ranging sales, marketing and business development experience, ideally gained in a professional services environment
  • Proven experience in driving client growth opportunities
  • Demonstrable sales support and coaching capability
  • Experience with developing and executing business plans and campaigns
  • Ability to liaise with multiple senior stakeholders and the ability to influence outcomes
  • Strong communication, project management and stakeholder management skills
  • Experience in B2B BD / marketing role with a focus on product and / or segment management, campaign development, communications and project management
  • Commercial focus with strong analytical, planning and project management skills
  • Sound financial acumen and excellent communication skills
  • Tertiary qualifications in marketing, communications or business or a related discipline


Who We Are

We embrace flexibility and empower all our people to learn, grow and become truly extraordinary. We provide our future leaders with best practice learning and development programs to accelerate and grow their careers. We value diversity in the workplace and care about ensuring you balance your professional goals with your commitments and interests outside of work. We have a wide range of social, financial and health benefits to support your wellbeing.

How To Apply

We prefer to deal with you directly, so if you would like to be considered please submit your CV and cover letter via our online portal by clicking on the 'Apply' button below. If you would like further information, please contact Alyce Bennett at Alyce.Bennett@minterellison.com for a highly confidential discussion.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time. To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Australia.

  • Law Practice
  • Legal Services

Full-time

Recruitment Consultant

Company Name Miller Leith Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 71 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About us

\xa0

Miller Leith is growing and it’s an exciting time to join our fun, hardworking team!

\xa0

We are looking for an ambitious and energetic Principal Consultant or Senior Principal Consultant who is looking to develop their skill\xa0set, has a hunger to learn and progress towards a long-term career at Miller Leith.

\xa0

We are seeking customer centric recruitment professionals who treat their clients and candidates with a genuine approach and lead with honesty and integrity. More than anything, we are looking for someone who has a desire to build meaningful relationships within our industry and amongst our team.

\xa0

The Role

\xa0

With the support of your manager, the leadership team and administration we are looking for someone to build their own client and candidate networks, working towards achieving sales targets, whilst focusing on account management and business development along the way.

\xa0

Our 360 recruitment process includes:

\xa0

  • Managing the selection process from job brief, sourcing candidates, reference checking through to offer, whilst ensuring open lines of communication.
  • Thorough understanding of and consulting on client recruitment needs.
  • Maximizing sales opportunities with current and prospective clients.
  • Maintain communication with candidates and clients, in order to build successful, long term partnerships.
  • Utilise our database and recruitment tools, including ensuring all client and candidate details and activities are accurately recorded in line with company requirements


Skills & Experience

\xa0

  • 2+ years’ experience in recruitment
  • Knowledge or experience in the FMCG/Retail industry would put you at a great advantage (although not essential)
  • Great communication, good listening skills and strong attention to detail
  • \xa0 You must show drive, passion and determination
  • An on target biller with proven sales
  • Previous account management/business development is desirable
  • A self-motivator who has excellent relationship and negotiation skills

\xa0

However, at Miller Leith, we also recognise a good candidate when we see one.

If you possess strong commercial acumen, great relationship building skills and know what it takes to make a good recruiter, we would love to hear from you!

\xa0

Benefits

\xa0

  • Be part of our vibrant, fun and hardworking culture and a business that is continually evolving
  • We like to celebrate the wins and keep things fun, with regular social events & celebrations
  • Opportunities for development with a blend of internal, external and on the job training with an annual budget in addition to your salary
  • We encourage regular paid community/volunteering and charity involvement
  • We participate in ongoing group fitness activities and offer a subsidised gym membership
  • We are centrally located in an open plan office with several break out areas and a pool table
  • We wear smart casual work attire that allows you to be comfortable and be yourself!

\xa0

Technical Applications Scientist 1

Company Name Illumina Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 79 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Basic Function And Scope Of The Position

This role provides technical direction and support to customers on operation and maintenance of company products. Serves as customer contact on technical and service-related problems. Support will include clinical customers and compliance with local and global clinical guidelines. Demonstrates uses and advantages of products. Works closely with sales and marketing, QA/QC, research and development to address customer concerns, determine corrective action and customer follow-up. May be responsible for a designated region.

Tasks And Responsibilities
  • Professionally, efficiently and conclusively triage, troubleshoot and resolve customer’s technical questions
  • Assist customers with the design and interpretation of gene expression, genotyping and “Next-Generation” sequencing experiments
  • Provide technical guidance regarding the choice and use of the appropriate Illumina product to existing and prospective customers
  • Assist customers with the selection of SNPs for custom genotyping projects by utilizing public and private sources and proprietary software applications
  • Triage and dispatch issues requiring field support to Illumina Engineers and Applications Scientists
  • Log and manage customer issues using Illumina’s issue-tracking database
  • Contributes to technical growth of colleagues in specialty and new projects.
  • Capable to write technical documentation within specialty and identify topics for these.
  • Identifies, initiates, and leads internal projects.
  • Participate in inter-organizational projects as technical resource and provide TS feedback
  • Willing and able to travel internationally for technical training and regional meetings
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.

Preferred Educational Background
  • Ph.D./ M.S or B.S. plus 2 years relevant lab experience in molecular biology, genetics, bioinformatics or related field

Preferred Experience & Skills
  • Hands-on laboratory experience using, developing or troubleshooting a wide range of molecular biology protocols such as PCR, sequencing, gene expression analysis, genotyping, and related procedures
  • Teaching experience desirable
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills required
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication and training skills a MUST
  • Experience working in any service role desired
  • Experience working in a clinical setting desired
Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

Industry

  • Biotechnology
  • Research
  • Medical Devices

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Research
  • Analyst
  • Information Technology
